description: From Middle English cronicle, cronycle, from Anglo-Norman cronicle, from Old French cronike, from Latin chronica, from Ancient Greek χρονικός (khronikós, “of or concerning time”), from χρόνος (khrónos, “time”).

entries.meaning: A written account of events and when they happened, ordered by time.

verbs.description: chronicle (third-person singular simple present chronicles, present participle chronicling, simple past and past participle chronicled)

entries.meaning: To record in or as in a chronicle.
